intro: Leonohebe tetrasticha, commonly known as the four-stemmed leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a whorled pattern along the stems. Leonohebe tetrasticha is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
